abstract: The people who are calling for a breakup of Citigroup are “off their mind,” the banking giant’s chairman emeritus Sanford I. Weill said on CNBC Monday. (That was actually a fairly mellow reaction, considering that, when Barron’s suggested the notion of a breakup to Citigroup chief executive Charles Prince last summer, Mr. Prince called it the “dumbest idea I’ve ever heard of.”)
